title.bibl: Magyar Tribune, Oct. 15, 1926. A New Hungarian Ladies Society

div.bibl: Magyar Tribune, Oct. 15, 1926. A NEW HUNGARIAN LADIES SOCIETY

body.p: The building of the Hungarian Home is already having a pronounced effect on Hungarian social life in Chicago.
Last Sunday afternoon a new Hungarian ladies society was organized, and during the meeting one hundred and four ladies were accepted as members.

The following ladies were elected as officers: Mrs. George Klajnik, president; Mrs. Michael Pfundstein, vice-president; Mrs. John Keri, secretary; Mrs. George Racz, treasurer, and Mrs. Vincent Kohl, corresponding secretary.

The purpose of this newly formed organization is to help promote functions in the Hungarian Home. They will co-operate with all societies having activities in this new Hungarian center. Their purpose is to get
four hundred members.
The name of this new organization is the Roman and Greek Catholic Ladies Society of Burnside and Vicinity.
